reviews.title: Great service
reviews.text: I stayed here whilst on a business trip from 14 Aug - 18 Sept, the rooms are comfortable and practical and have everything you need for a stay of a few weeks, the hotel is close to the city centre and the train station is not far away, there are a few good food places and pubs nearby.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: Furniture is modern, rooms are cleaned every day and nothing is too much of a problem for them.
If you are staying for a few weeks there are invites to go to a free wine tasting and network.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: I enjoyed it and would recommend it to anyone. One thing tho', over in Oz, they are lagging way behind in the internet / wireless stakes and even tho the hotel is expensive they do not give you broadband access for free... seems a bit tight of them!
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel
Great location
reviews.text: Somewhat disappointed with the hotel. Felt that it was not worth the amount we paid for it which is at AUD175 per night. If we included our carpark charges it would have cost us AUD187 per night. Was given a horrible room (Rm 107) the first night. The aircond was very loud and the noise from a squeaking hinge outside the room kept me and my husband awake the whole night. They managed to change our room to a better room but it could still need some improvements ie... proper coat of paint on the walls, servicing of the airconditioner which was not very cold etc...All in all it was a disappointment.

reviews.title: Excellent location
reviews.text: We took a studio room. Had a kitchenette. There are apparantly good stuido rooms and bad ones so make sure you get a good one. The one we had was 725 and was quite spacious. The location was perfect. Right next to the mall and in the heart of the city. 5 min walk to the station which proved really handy as Subiaco/Cottesloe Beach/Burswood Casino were all accessible by train.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleaners serviced the rooms at 3-4pm which was annoying at times as that was when we'd be back for a rest.
reviews.title: good location with road works opposite

reviews.text: Perth is a beautiful city. Beaches are amazing. Probably the prettiest
reviews.title: Great location good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and most liveable one in Australia. Lots of flies though.
reviews.title: Unhelpful and unsympathetic reception

reviews.text: They have a wagamama restaurant in Subiaco btw.
reviews.title: Pretty average but great location.

reviews.text: We thought the location of the jotel was great as it was only walking distance to the shopping area BUT the parking is a big problem if you have a car. We were told to park in the car park down a narrow street across from the hotel but rates were extremely high. Car parks or areas to load and unload your luggage is not avaliable in front of the hotel and there is no staff help at all on this matter. Also for the price we were paying I thought there would be porter service but the hotel only has 24 hours reception.
reviews.title: Great shopping location

likes.disliked: — No car park area and no porter service

reviews.text: Our room was ok but had no view only of the sides of the biulding. Our sofa bed collapsed so the hotel gave us a rollaway bed for free. Cleanliness was ok and the room was cleaned daily, although there was a sign to say that if we left any dirty dishes upon check out an extra chagre would be levied! Bathroom size was alright but shower and bath space rather small.
reviews.title: Nightmare stay

likes.liked: — Large room, located near the malls
likes.disliked: — It's lack of carparking and the fact you had to get your bags up a flight of stairs to get to reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had rung the hotel prior to arriving to arrange carparking and were told it was straight across the road and you get a discounted rate as a hotel guest. When we arrived we drove around the block 3 times and could not see the carparking.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location
Nice and clean, Great location
reviews.text: Beside the building was some carparking labelled private. We parked here for less then 10 minutes to get our bags out and go ask them at the counter where we had to go for carparking and in this time our vehicle was wheel clamped. The manager of the hotel admitted this regularly happened to guests, but was very reluctant to do anything about it without a lot of complaint. To this day we have not recieved a refund for the wheel clamping.

The carparking ended up being on another street and another block away. So much for just across the road! In addition to this if you wanted to enter and leave the carpark more then once a day you were charged each time. Oh and although doing it through the hotel was at a rate of something like $12 a day for one entry compared to the usual rate of something like $16, the hotel slugged a $3 processing fee. Some saving not!
reviews.title: Great place to stay....
